subject: Fw: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property

full_threads.body:
Hi Megs,

We are looking into this.

We have whitelisted the IP address for piplus and sgua.

Regarding the SGUA it seems that the dns is not pointing to the server. Can you check with your IT? and update the records

A record 1
Name/host: @
IP address: 162.159.134.42

CNAME
Name/host: www
Domain Name: sgua.com.au

Hi there,

Can you kindly whitelist the below IP (South African digital agency) for:
https://www.pi-plus.com.au/
https://sgua.com.au/

Thank you so much,


From: Ansulette Bekker
Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 9:02 PM
To: Megs Hollis
Cc: Carey Straiton; Corlia du Preez
Subject: Re: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property

Dear Megs,

I hope you are well!

Can your team please whitelist our IP address: 105.29.233.115

Hopefully this will help with tracking :) Thank you in advance!

Kind regards,
Ansulette

On Wed, 19 Mar 2025 at 09:23, Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Perfect thank you so much Ansulette! Let's do that, all a bit complicated over email.

Much appreciated,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au
www.pi-plus.com.au

If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.
From: Ansulette Bekker <ansulette.bekker@rogerwilco.co.za>
Sent: Wednesday, March 19, 2025 3:20 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Cc: Carey Straiton <carey.straiton@rogerwilco.co.uk>; Corlia du Preez <corlia.dupreez@rogerwilco.co.za>
Subject: Re: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property
Dear Megs,

I hope you are keeping well!

I had a chat with our performance team, and I think it would be best if we can address this during our Meet & Greet on the 27th :) Would this be okay with you?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,
Ansulette

On Tue, 18 Mar 2025 at 13:03, Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Thank you so much Ansulette for confirming. I'm so thrilled you guys are thinking of all these tracking intricacies, so much appreciated! Before we even kick off nogal!
When I look at the GTM container IDs, the PI-Plus one looks to be the same as the one our tech team provided (from Entsia).

Would best practise be to have a second container implemented which matches the SGUA container ID?
https://sgua.entsia.io/

What is a bit confusing is that the Entsia domain is always sgua.entsia.io regardless of whether the brand is PI-Plus or SGUA (it just denotes it's our back end system - which handles everything off Wordpress - all quoting of new policies, all customer data etc).

At the moment it looks to me like it might work for PI-Plus but not SGUA?
Otherwise if I am misunderstanding we can always chat it through next Thursday 🙂










Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au
www.pi-plus.com.au

The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.
From: Ansulette Bekker <ansulette.bekker@rogerwilco.co.za>
Sent: Tuesday, March 18, 2025 5:58 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Cc: Carey Straiton <carey.straiton@rogerwilco.co.uk>; Corlia du Preez <corlia.dupreez@rogerwilco.co.za>
Subject: Re: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property
Dear Megs,

Thank you for giving us GSC access! Our team has confirmed the access.

For the conversion link, the https://sgua.entsia.io/ domain needs to use the same GTM and Google Tag as the two domains (SGUA and PIP) in order to enable cross-domain tracking. If the conversion link domain does not use the same Google Tag as the site we are trying to track conversions for, we won't be able to implement cross-domain tracking. This means we won't have insight into whether the user has converted or simply clicked the CTA. Can you please ensure that the same Google tags are implemented for the conversion link?

Please let me know if you have any questions or if we can maybe hop on a call with the team to sort it out :)

Kind regards,
Ansulette


On Tue, 18 Mar 2025 at 04:27, Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Hi Ansulette!

I have two updates for you 🙂

You should now has GSC access to SGUA as well as PIP, I managed to get you added this morning 🙂

Re tracking on Entsia - is Google Tag Manager sufficient for this?


Thank you so much!

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Thank you, Megs! I'll keep you posted on our IP address once received.

Kind regards,
Ansulette

On Fri, 14 Mar 2025 at 11:16, Ansulette Bekker <ansulette.bekker@rogerwilco.co.za> wrote:
Dear Megs,

I hope you are well!

I'm just waiting on our IT team to provide me with our static IP address, and I will provide is as soon as I have it!

Regarding the PIP blog posts, I will run this by the team and revert back as soon as possible :)

Kind regards,
Ansulette

On Thu, 13 Mar 2025 at 06:21, Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Hello lovely Ansulette,

Confirming:
analytics@rwcloud.co.za
Has been added as admin to:

https://sgua.com.au/backend/
https://www.pi-plus.com.au/backend/
https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/wp-admin

I can't remember if I explained but we had to change our back end links to minimize risk of bots etc. which target the default /wp-login/ pages.
In order to be compliant, we also need to have 2FA set up, so you have 14 days to set up the top two.
2FA hasn't yet been implemented on the bottom staging site.

Shout if you would like me to add any other email addys.

Re IP address - I actually just managed to do this with a freelance developer - if you can share your IP address I can ask our hosting provider to whitelist you on both sites and we see if this fixes the issue. (Might have WFH considerations but lets see!)

I will follow up on:
Search Console access for SGUA, as well as the GA4 setup for https://sgua.entsia.io/

And then I wanted to ask for your advice on something PIP related 🙂

On our old Pip website, we didn't have a blog and so with the new website launch (timing still TBC), we want to make sure we have adequate content to go live with our "ARTICLES" section (at at the moment we just have dummy content on the staging link) -
https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/articles/

With our old SEO provider, they were giving us the topic ideas based on search volumes but our team didn't like the topic ideas often as they felt like they were too consumer led e.g. "Am I overinsured?" is a common q on Google but one of our biggest problems is underinsurance of our clients. Then we would end up with a blog post we weren't able to publish as its kind of at odds with the education we need to do to support customers come claim time when they realise they aren't covered for something.

I also don't want to tell you guys what content to create as I would think we need a balance of what you advise us regarding rankings and volumes, but the below is a list of what we would really like see on the new Pip site. Could you kindly advise if it would be possible (only need be in April when retainer would kick in) - if your team can analyse the below and see if you guys could run with some or all of these?

I got ChatGPT to write an outline of the first four (see attached) and the feedback was really positive, with minor feedback noted underneath the topic list.


MONTH 1

  • Why It's Essential to Have Building Insurance in Addition to Landlord Insurance
  • What is the Difference Between Loss of Rent & Rent Default?

MONTH 2

  • Property Maintenance Tips for Every Season: A Landlord's Guide for Australian Property Owners
  • Top 10 Questions About Landlord Insurance in Australia: Answered

MONTH 3

  • From Leak to Repair: A Landlord's Guide to Handling Water Damage & Insurance Claims﻿
    • Awareness of loss of liquid claims (how prevalent they are, common causes)
    • Symptoms of a burst pipe (noises etc) ﻿
    • Remediation - how to fix things
  • Protecting Your Investment: How to Ensure Your Property Is Adequately Insured
    • Provide examples like - If you're insured for less than your mortgage, you have a serious issue.﻿

MONTH 4

  • The Cost of Neglect: What Happens If You Don't Get Your Smoke Alarms Checked?
  • From Scratches to Surprises: Pets in Rentals

MONTH 5
  • Common Landlord Insurance Myths Debunked
  • The Most Common Landlord Insurance Claims (And How to Avoid Them)

MONTH 6
  • Short-Term Rentals & Airbnb: What Landlords Need to Know About Insurance
  • How Landlord Insurance Protects You from Natural Disasters

Feedback from the team already received:
With the Top 10 Questions - under Malicious Damage, can we call out that PIP offers the more comprehensive cover of Deliberate Damage which includes Malicious damage (damage caused with intent) as well as Damage caused by a Deliberate action (a reasonable person should foresee that their action could cause damage)? Our PDS doesn't actually say Malicious damage, so it always causes confusion.

With the copy for the combined BD & LD article, it must highlight the loss of rent AND damage component relevant to BD cover. The current CAT highlights where owners/PMs will be caught out if they've only actioned LL cover for a free-standing home.

Thank you so much,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au
www.pi-plus.com.au

The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.

From: Ansulette Bekker <ansulette.bekker@rogerwilco.co.za>
Sent: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 9:24 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Cc: Carey Straiton <carey.straiton@rogerwilco.co.uk>; Corlia du Preez <corlia.dupreez@rogerwilco.co.za>
Subject: Re: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property
Dear Megs,

I hope you are well!

Please let me know if IT was able to help on your side regarding the Search Console access for SGUA, as well as the GA4 setup for https://sgua.entsia.io/

Regarding the VPN issue, our team suggests whitelisting us on both sites or adjusting the region block restrictions to give access to our IP address. I would just like to explain why we would need access to the conversion link: it is essential to follow and track the entire customer journey, and the current setup only tracks when users land on the sites (and not when they convert). Since Google Tag isn't on the conversion link, this means that Google Ads can't track actual conversions, so it optimizes for clicks rather than results. Additionally, key data like conversion rates and ROAS are missing, making it more difficult to measure success.

We recommend adding the same Google Tag to the conversion domain for cross-domain tracking, ensuring accurate conversion tracking and campaign optimization.

For SEO purposes, can our team perhaps get backend access to the landing sites?

I look forward to hearing from you!

Kind regards,
Ansulette

On Tue, 11 Mar 2025 at 02:32, Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Good morning Ansulette!

I have managed to give access to - pi-plus search console dash -


But when I try for SGUA it says -


So I think I might need my IT team's support with that.

2. Cross-Domain Tracking I will also need to speak to our IT team about this.
- A big part of the user journey happens on https://sgua.entsia.io/ for conversions, however, this domain isn't set up on GA4. Can you please add this to both brand's GA4, to enable us to track conversions effectively?

- I also want to note that the abovementioned domain requires a VPN to access, which might make tracking more complicated. Our team suggests using Google Tag Manager for the conversion domains to aid in tracking. However, we may need to investigate a solution here so that we can accurately report on the performance of each campaign. Happy to take your advice on how we can do this 🙂

3. Additional Property Insurance Domain
- I know you are relaunching Property Insurance Plus as Property Insurance People. Please confirm if we will be reporting on the new domain or the current domain?
We don't yet have a launch date sadly for the new brand, but that is our main focus as we haven't been running any media for Property Insurance Plus but will be running media for Property Insurance People.
I would suggest focusing on reporting for the new brand rather than trying to set it up for old and new.

I will ask our IT team and see what more we can do to assist you in gaining the access you need.

Thank you so much Ansulette,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au
www.pi-plus.com.au

From: Ansulette Bekker <ansulette.bekker@rogerwilco.co.za>
Sent: Monday, March 10, 2025 9:33 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Cc: Carey Straiton <carey.straiton@rogerwilco.co.uk>; Corlia du Preez <corlia.dupreez@rogerwilco.co.za>
Subject: SGUA & PIP: Google Search Console access, and GA4 property
Dear Megs,

I hope you are well and had a lovely weekend!

I had the team set up the dashboards for PIP and SGUA last week, and they came back with some feedback and requests that I just want to run by you.

1. Google Search Console access
- Can you please give our team access to SGUA and PIP's Google Search Console? The email to give access to is analytics@rwcloud.co.za

2. Cross-Domain Tracking
- A big part of the user journey happens on https://sgua.entsia.io/ for conversions, however, this domain isn't set up on GA4. Can you please add this to both brand's GA4, to enable us to track conversions effectively?

- I also want to note that the abovementioned domain requires a VPN to access, which might make tracking more complicated. Our team suggests using Google Tag Manager for the conversion domains to aid in tracking. However, we may need to investigate a solution here so that we can accurately report on the performance of each campaign.

3. Additional Property Insurance Domain
- I know you are relaunching Property Insurance Plus as Property Insurance People. Please confirm if we will be reporting on the new domain or the current domain?

I look forward to your response!

Kind regards,


Largest B-Corp Marketing
Agency in Africa
